title: Donald Trump's fortune boosted by golf courses, talks – and Telstra
text:
Paid speeches are lucrative for Donald Trump. AP Speak and pay When Trump talks, people listen – and pay. Trump's company ACN paid him $US450,000 in revenue from speaking engagements, while he charged three other specific retail organisations as much as $US100,00 for speeches. But the biggest gig was for electronics giant Samsung, who shelled out $US150,000 for some wise words from The Donald.
Paperback writer Get rich quick books ain't what they used to be – making the author, not the reader, gazillions.
 For example, Trump's 2004 How to Get Rich , generated the billionaire zilch, or less than $US201, in royalties, in 2014.
In fact, Trump didn't have much luck at all across his 14 titles. Only three delivered the author a royalties cheque, with Think Like a Champion , The Art of the Deal and Time to Get Tough , earning their spot on the bookshelf.
Rainy day On the theme of Time to Get Tough, even billionaires need to plan for less than lucrative times.
In Trump's case, he has a pension plan with the Screen Actors Guild, which contributes a modest $US110,228 a year to his wealth.
Sleepy head Not only can you dress like Trump - his menswear licensing deal earned him up to $US5 million in 2014 – you can also sleep like the man.
Another licensing deal, this one with US mattress company Serta, also earned him up to $US5 million.
Serta's website says: "Trump is a name synonymous with the upscale lifestyle, superior quality and success of Donald Trump and his world-renowned empire. Now, you can enjoy Trump luxury in your own home with our all-new Trump Home iSeries mattress collection".
Thankfully, it makes no mention of the pyjama games of billionaires.
Tee off The main driver of the business magnate's fortune is his 16-related golf businesses, which are worth $US550-675 million.
That's more than half of his net worth, which the filing said was at least $1.15 billion.
Trump himself, however, says he is worth closer to $10 billion. But it's impossible to determine an exact figure just looking at the 92-page financial disclosure .
That's because any asset worth more than $50 million gets counted the same, and Trump is claiming 23 of those, such as his aircraft, the Mar-A-Lago Club in Palm Beach, Florida and a golf course in Scotland.
Watch but don't learn Trump skills as an entrepreneur haven't translated into education as it might have hoped. A company called The Trump Entrepreneur Initiative, which says its underlying assets are a "seminar program" had revenue of just $US11,819 since the beginning of 2014.
